justification: "Beads Task. The JTC bias was assessed using the 85:15 and 60:40 versions of the beads task, as they are the most common versions that are tested."
"Decision Threshold Beads Task. We adapted the original beads task … to assess the decision threshold on the basis of objective probabilities with a signal detection analytical approach."
"Confirmation Bias. We assessed children's confirmation bias with six items from a self-assessment questionnaire (e.g., 'My first impression usually seems to be correct'; Rassin, 2008)."
"Alternation Bias. We assessed the alternation bias with a self-developed instrument. Participants were told to create three sequences of 20 coin-throw results that looked random to them."

measured_by: Nine adapted items (Conley et al., 2004; Urhahne & Hopf, 2004)
justification: "Epistemic Certainty Beliefs. We assessed children's epistemic certainty beliefs with nine adapted items (e.g., 'If you have found something out, it is certainly true'; Conley et al., 2004; Urhahne & Hopf, 2004)."
"Self-Reported Mathematics Grade. Math performance was assessed by asking the participants 'What grade did you get in math on your last report card?'"

measured_by: Six-item self-concept scale (Arens et al., 2011; Gaspard et al., 2015)
justification: "Self-Concept in Data-Related Tasks. We assessed children's domain-specific self-concept with six items (e.g., 'Anything that has to do with data is easy for me'; Arens et al., 2011; Gaspard et al., 2015)."

measured_by: Short form of the Self-Efficacy Scale (Beierlein et al., 2012)
justification: "General Self-Efficacy. We assessed general self-efficacy with the short form of the self-efficacy scale from Beierlein et al. (2012)."
